item.title: Cinnamon 3.0 Desktop Primed For Release - Phoronix
item.description:
Cinnamon 3.0 Desktop Primed For Release - Phoronix

The GNOME3-forked Cinnamon Desktop is ready for its 3.0 milestone. Linux Mint lead developer Clement Lefebvre has tagged version 3.0 of Cinnamon within their official Git repository on GitHub.

item.title: Microsoft reveals all about Windows 10's Linux subsystem
item.description:
Microsoft reveals all about Windows 10's Linux subsystem

The arrival of Bash in Windows 10 took many people by surprise, but it opens up a number of opportunities including the ability to run GUI Linux apps. But it's about much more than just that. Microsoft wants people who are confused about the arrival of (deep breath...)

item.title: Mozilla Firefox Will Support Ubuntu's New Snap Package Format - OMG! Ubuntu!
item.description:
Mozilla Firefox Will Support Ubuntu's New Snap Package Format - OMG! Ubuntu!

Today's release of Ubuntu 16.04 LTS brings Canonical's new Snap package system to millions of desktops. Canonical's new packaging format gets some big-name support As we highlighted earlier this week, Snaps can be installed side-by-side with the more familiar .Deb packages, giving users the best of both worlds.

item.title: Xubuntu 16.04 LTS and Lubuntu 16.04 LTS Released, Get Three Years of Support
item.description:
Xubuntu 16.04 LTS and Lubuntu 16.04 LTS Released, Get Three Years of Support

Xubuntu and Lubuntu are the last two official Ubuntu flavors released as part of the massive Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (Xenial Xerus) launch, and we're going to tell you a little about their presence.

item.title: Linux 4.6-rc5 Is Another Fairly Calm Weekly Kernel Update - Phoronix
item.description:
Linux 4.6-rc5 Is Another Fairly Calm Weekly Kernel Update - Phoronix

Linus Torvalds announced the release of the Linux 4.6-rc5 kernel a brief time ago. Torvalds explained of 4.6-rc5, "Things continue to be fairly calm: rc5 is bigger than rc4 was, but rc4 really was tiny.

item.title: How to build a Linux router, Internet of Things devices, and more news
item.description:
How to build a Linux router, Internet of Things devices, and more news

In this week's edition of our open source news roundup, we take a look at how to build a Linux router, why Internet of Things devices should be completely open source, and more!

item.title: Vulkan 1.0.11 Is The Latest, Scripts/XML/Headers Changed To Apache License - Phoronix
item.description:
Vulkan 1.0.11 Is The Latest, Scripts/XML/Headers Changed To Apache License - Phoronix

There's another weekly point release of the Vulkan high performance graphics API. Vulkan 1.0.11 was released this week with several more clarifications to the documentation, typo fixes, and other relatively mundane changes to the Vulkan 1.0 specification. Likely most noteworthy is the changing of the script/XML/header files (not the specification itself) from the Khronos Free Use License to now the Apache 2.0 license.

item.title: Slides From Linux Foundation's 2016 File-System Conference - Phoronix
item.description:
Slides From Linux Foundation's 2016 File-System Conference - Phoronix

Phoronix is the leading technology website for Linux hardware reviews, open-source news, Linux benchmarks, open-source benchmarks, and computer hardware tests.

item.title: ​Ubuntu Linux 16.04 is here | ZDNet
item.description:
​Ubuntu Linux 16.04 is here | ZDNet

Who's ready for the next long-term support version of Ubuntu? There's something new here whether you use Ubuntu on the desktop, server, cloud, smartphone, tablet, or mainframe. Yes, mainframe.
